gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material with more than 63 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:acidic_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel igné acide
materiale igneo acido
acidic igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with more than 63 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:acidic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée acide
roccia ignea acida
acidic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock mainly consisting of green, brown or black amphibole and plagioclase (including albite), which combined form 75 percent or more of the rock, and both of which are present as major constituents. The amphibole constitutes 50 percent or more of the total mafic constituents and is present in an amount of 30 percent or more; other common minerals include quartz, clinopyroxene, garnet, epidote-group minerals, biotite, titanite and scapolite. (Coutinho et al. 2007, IUGS SCMR chapter 8 (http://www.bgs.ac.uk/SCMR/))
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:amphibolite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: amphibolites
anfibolite
amphibolite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained crystalline rock, usually porphyritic, consisting of plagioclase (frequently zoned from labradorite to oligoclase), pyroxene, hornblende and/or biotite; color index M less than 35. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field O2 as andesite. Fine grained equivalent of dioritic rock. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:andesitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: andésites
andesite
andesitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: General term for a leucocratic phaneritic crystalline rock consisting essentially of plagioclase, often with small amounts of pyroxene; colour index M less than 10. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 10 as anorthosite. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:anorthositic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: anorthosite
anortosite
anorthositic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:anthropogenic_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel anthropique
materiale antropico
anthropogenic material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated material known to have artificial (human-related) origin. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:anthropogenic_unconsolidated_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: marériel anthropique non consolidé
materiale antropico non consolidato
anthropogenic unconsolidated material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock that is too fine grained to categorize in more detail. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:aphanite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche aphanitique
roccia afanitica
aphanite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Light coloured crystalline rock, characterized by a fine grained allotriomorphic-granular (aplitic, saccharoidal or xenomorphic) texture; typically granitic composition, consisting of quartz, K-feldspar and sodic plagioclase. (Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:aplite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: aplite
aplite
aplite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Tephra in which less than 25 percent of fragments are greater than 64 mm in longest dimension (Schmid 1981; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:ash_and_lapilli
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: cendre et lapilli
cenere e lapilli
Ash and lapilli

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Tephra in which more than 25 percent of particles are greater than 64 mm in largest dimension. Includes ash breccia, bomb tephra and block tephra of Gillespie and Styles (1999) (Schmid 1981; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:ash_breccia_bomb_or_block_tephra
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: brèche cendreuse , bombe, ou bloques de téphra
tephra a brecce cineritiche, a bombe vulcaniche, a blocchi
Ash breccia, bomb, or block tephra

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Pyroclastic rock in which less than 25 percent of rock by volume are more than 64 mm in longest diameter. Includes tuff, lapilli tuff, and lapillistone. (Schmid 1981; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:ash_tuff_lapillistone_and_lapilli_tuff
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: cendre tuffacé, lapilli, et tuf lapillitique
tufo cineritico, tufo a lapilli
Ash tuff, lapillistone, and lapilli tuff

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine-grained or porphyritic igneous rock with less than 20 percent quartz, and less than 10 percent feldspathoid minerals, in which the ratio of plagioclase to alkali feldspar is greater than 66 percent, and the color index is greater than 35. Typically composed of calcic plagioclase and clinopyroxene; phenocrysts typically include one or more of calcic plagioclase, clinopyroxene, orthopyroxene, and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 or chemically in TAS field B as basalt. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:basaltic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: basaltes
basalto
basaltic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material with between 45 and 52 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:basic_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel igné basique
materiale igneo basico
basic igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with between 45 and 52 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:basic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée basique
roccia ignea basica
basic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Highly aluminous material containing abundant aluminium hydroxides (gibbsite, less commonly boehmite, diaspore) and aluminium-substituted iron oxides or hydroxides and generally minor or negligible kaolin minerals; may contain up to 20 percent quartz. Commonly has a pisolitic or nodular texture, and may be cemented. (Eggleton, 2001)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:bauxite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: bauxite
bauxite
bauxite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment composed of greater than 50 percent material of biogenic origin. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:biogenic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment biogénique
sedimento biogenico
biogenic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by biological processes within the basin of deposition. (based on NADM SLTT sedimentary; Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:biogenic_silica_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire siliceuse biogénique
roccia sedimentaria biogenica silicea
biogenic silica sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary carbonate rock with preserved biogenic texture, whose original components were bound and encrusted together during deposition by the action of plants and animals during deposition, and remained substantially in the position of growth. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999; SLTTs 2004)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:boundstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: boundstone
boundstone
boundstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Coarse-grained material composed of angular broken rock fragments; the fragments typically have sharp edges and unworn corners. The fragments may be held together by a mineral cement, or in a fine-grained matrix. Clasts may be of any composition or origin. (Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:breccia
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: brèches
breccia
breccia

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fault material with features such as void spaces (filled or unfilled), or unconsolidated matrix material between fragments, indicating loss of cohesion during deformation. Includes fault-related breccia and gouge. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:breccia_gouge_series
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: brèche de faille
breccia di faglia
breccia-gouge series

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment with a calcite (plus aragonite) to dolomite ratio greater than 1 to 1. Includes lime-sediments. (after Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:calcareous_carbonate_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment carbonaté calcaire
sedimento calcareo carbonatico
calcareous carbonate sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation state with a calcite (plus aragonite) to dolomite ratio greater than 1 to 1. Includes lime-sediments, limestone and dolomitic limestone. (after Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:calcareous_carbonate_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire carbonaté calcaire
materiale sedimentario calcareo carbonatico
calcareous carbonate sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with a calcite (plus aragonite) to dolomite ratio greater than 1 to 1. Includes limestone and dolomitic limestone. (NADM SLTT sedimentary; Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:calcareous_carbonate_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcaires
calcare
calcareous carbonate sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment composed of more than 25 percent gravel-sized clasts (maximum diameter more than 2 mm). (Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_gravel
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gravier carbonaté
ghiaia calcarea
carbonate gravel

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment composed of more than 75 percent mud-sized clasts (maximum diameter less than 32 microns). (Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_mud
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: boue carbonatée
fango calcareo
carbonate mud

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with matrix-supported fabric, composed of more than 75 percent mud-sized grains (maximum diameter less than 32 microns). The original depositional texture is preserved. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999; NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_mudstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: mudstone carbonatée
mudstone carbonatico
carbonate mudstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment composed of more than 75 percent sand-sized clasts (maximum diameter between 32 microns and 2 mm). (Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_sand
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sable carbonaté
sabbia calcarea
carbonate sand

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are composed of one (or more) of the carbonate minerals calcite, aragonite and dolomite, in particles of intrabasinal origin. (after NADM SLTT sedimentary rocks)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment carbonaté
sedimento carbonatico
carbonate sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are composed of one (or more) of the carbonate minerals calcite, aragonite and dolomite, in particles of intrabasinal origin. (after NADM SLTT sedimentary rocks)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire carbonaté
materiale sedimentario carbonatico
carbonate sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are composed of one (or more) of the carbonate minerals calcite, aragonite and dolomite, in particles of intrabasinal origin. (after NADM SLTT sedimentary rocks)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire carbonaté
roccia sedimentaria carbonatica
carbonate sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with discernible mud supported depositional texture and containing greater than 10 percent grains. ()
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonate_wackestone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcaire wackestone
wackestone carbonatico
carbonate wackestone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock composed of more than 50 percent modal carbonate minerals. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:carbonatite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: carbonatite
carbonatite
carbonatite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fault-related rock that maintained primary cohesion during deformation, with matrix comprising 50 to 90 percent of rock mass; matrix is fine-grained material caused by tectonic grainsize reduction. Includes cataclasite, protocataclasite and ultracataclasite. (Sibson, 1977; Scholz, 1990; Snoke and Tullis, 1998; Barker, 1998 Appendix II; NADM SLTTm, 2004)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:cataclasite_series
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: cataclasites
cataclasite
cataclasite series

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment that consists of at least 50 percent material produced by chemical (organic or inorganic) processes within the basin of deposition. Includes organic-rich, non-clastic siliceous, carbonate, evaporite, iron-rich, and phosphatic sediment classes. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:chemical_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment chimique
sedimento chimico
chemical sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment in which at least 50 percent of the constituent particles were derived from erosion, weathering, or mass-wasting of pre-existing earth materials, and transported to the place of deposition by mechanical agents such as water, wind, ice and gravity. (SLTTs, 2004; Neuendorf et al., 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:clastic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment clastique
sedimento clastico
clastic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation state in which at least 50 percent of the constituent particles were derived from erosion, weathering, or mass-wasting of pre-existing earth materials, and transported to the place of deposition by mechanical agents such as water, wind, ice and gravity. (SLTTs, 2004; Neuendorf et al., 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:clastic_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire clastique
materiale sedimentario clastico
clastic sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which at least 50 percent of the constituent particles were derived from erosion, weathering, or mass-wasting of pre-existing earth materials, and transported to the place of deposition by mechanical agents such as water, wind, ice and gravity. (SLTTs, 2004; Neuendorf et al., 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:clastic_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire clastique
roccia detritica
clastic sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Hard, black, organic rich sedimentary rock that yields greater than 8,300 Btu on a moist, mineral-matter-free basis, or contains greater than 69 percent fixed carbon on a dry, mineral-matter-free basis; formed from the compaction or induration of variously altered plant remains similar to those of peaty deposits. (ASTM 2002; Schopf 1956)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:coal
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: charbons
carbone
coal

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material of unspecified consolidation state formed by geological modification of pre-existing materials outside the realm of igneous and sedimentary processes. Includes rocks formed by impact metamorphism, standard dynamothermal metamorphism, brittle deformation, weathering, metasomatism and hydrothermal alteration (diagenesis is a sedimentary process in this context). (NADM SLTT metamorphic)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:composite_genesis_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel modifié et/ou transformé
materiale modificato o trasformato
composite (transformed) genesis material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed by geological modification of pre-existing rocks outside the realm of igneous and sedimentary processes. Includes rocks formed by impact metamorphism, standard dynamothermal metamorphism, brittle deformation, weathering, metasomatism and hydrothermal alteration (diagenesis is a sedimentary process in this context). (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:composite_genesis_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche modifiée et/ou transformée
roccia modificata o trasformata
composite (transformed) genesis rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Coarse grained sedimentary rock composed of at least 30 percent rounded to subangular fragments larger than 2 mm in diameter; typically contains finer grained material in interstices between larger fragments. (Neuendorf et al. 2005; NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:conglomerate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: conglomérats
conglomerato
conglomerate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate rock of indeterminate mineralogy in which diagenetic processes have obliterated any original depositional texture. (NADM SLTTs 2004)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:crystalline_carbonate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcaire cristallin
calcare cristallino
crystalline carbonate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained or porphyritic crystalline rock composed of quartz and sodic plagioclase with minor amounts of biotite and/or hornblende and/or pyroxene; volcanic equivalent of granodiorite and tonalite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 4 and 5 or chemically in TAS Field O3. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:dacitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dacites
dacite
dacitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:diamictite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tillite
diamictite
diamictite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unsorted or poorly sorted, clastic sediment with a wide range of particle sizes such that it cannot be assigned to any other class. (Fairbridge and Bourgeois 1978)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:diamicton
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diamictite
diamicton
diamicton

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of intermediate plagioclase, commonly with hornblende and often with biotite or augite; colour index M less than 90, sodic plagioclase (An0-An50). Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 10 as diorite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:diorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diorites
diorite
diorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock with M less than 90, consisting of intermediate plagioclase, commonly with hornblende and often with biotite or augite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 as diorite, monzodiorite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:dioritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diorites
roccia dioritica
dioritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Dark colored gabbroic (basaltic) or dioritic (andesitic) rock intermediate in grain size between basalt and gabbro and composed of plagioclase, pyroxene and opaque minerals; often with ophitic texture. Typically occurs as hypabyssal intrusions. Includes dolerite, microdiorite, diabase and microgabbro. (Neuendorf et al 2005; LeMaitre et al 2002; Gillespie and Styles, 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:doleritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dolérites
dolerite
doleritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation degree with a ratio of magnesium carbonate to calcite (plus aragonite) greater than 1 to 1. Includes dolomite sediment, dolostone, lime dolostone and magnesite-stone. (after NADM SLTTs 2004, Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:dolomitic_or_magnesian_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire dolomitique ou magnésien
materiale sedimentario dolomitico o magnesiaco
dolomitic or magnesian sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with a ratio of magnesium carbonate to calcite (plus aragonite) greater than 1 to 1. Includes dolostone, lime dolostone and magnesite-stone. (after NADM SLTTs 2004, Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:dolomitic_or_magnesian_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: dolomies
dolomia
dolomitic or magnesian sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sediment with a ratio of magnesium carbonate to calcite (plus aragonite) greater than 1 to 1. (after NADM SLTTs 2004, Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:dolomitic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment dolomitique
sedimento dolomitico
dolomitic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock forming a hard crust or layer at or near the Earth's surface at the time of formation, e.g. in the upper horizons of a soil, characterized by structures indicative of pedogenic origin. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:duricrust
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: calcrète
duricrust (o orizzonte indurito)
duricrust

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock composed of 75 percent or more (by volume) omphacite and garnet, both of which are present as major constituents, the amount of neither of them being higher than 75 percent (by volume); the presence of plagioclase precludes classification as an eclogite. (IUGS SCMR 2007 (http://www.bgs.ac.uk/SCMR/))
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:eclogite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: éclogites
eclogite
eclogite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Nonclastic sedimentary rock composed of at least 50 percent non-carbonate salts, including chloride, sulfate or borate minerals; formed through precipitation of mineral salts from a saline solution (non-carbonate salt rock). (Jackson 1997; NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:evaporite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: évaporites
evaporite
evaporite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock containing greater than 10 percent melilite or kalsilite. Typically undersaturated, ultrapotassic (kalsilitic rocks) or calcium-rich (melilitic rocks) mafic or ultramafic rocks. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:exotic_alkalic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée exotique alcaline
roccia ignea esotica alcalina
exotic alkalic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Kimberlite, lamproite, or lamprophyre. Generally are potassic, mafic or ultramafic rocks. Olivine (commonly serpentinized in kimberlite), and phlogopite are significant constituents. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:exotic_alkaline_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche exotique alcaline
roccia esotica alcalina
exotic alkaline rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock with 'exotic' mineralogical, textural or field setting characteristics; typically dark colored, with abundant phenocrysts. Criteria include: presence of greater than 10 percent melilite or leucite; presence of kalsilite; greater than 50 percent carbonate minerals. (Gillespie and Styles 1999; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:exotic_composition_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée de composition exotique
roccia ignea a composizione esotica
exotic composition igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material formed as a result brittle faulting, composed of greater than 10 percent matrix; matrix is fine-grained material caused by tectonic grainsize reduction. Includes cohesive (cataclasite series) and non-cohesive (breccia-gouge series) material. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:fault_related_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: brèches de faille
breccia di faglia
fault-related material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Aphanitic or porphyritic igneous rock composed of greater than 10 percent groundmass, in which most of the crystals cannot be distinguished with the unaided eye; grainsize is typically less than 1mm. Igneous rocks with 'exotic' composition are excluded from this concept. (Gillespie and Styles 1999; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:fine_grained_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée à grain fin
roccia ignea a grana fine
fine grained igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock in which M is less than 90, composed of feldspathoids as 10-60 percent of the felsic minerals, sodic plagioclase (An0-An50) and large amounts of mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 14. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:foid_dioritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: diorites foïdique
diorite foiditica
foid dioritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock in which M is less than 90, composed of feldspathoids as 10-60 percent of the felsic minerals, calcic plagioclase (An50-An100) and large amounts of mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 14. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:foid_gabbroic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gabbros foïdique
gabbro foiditico
foid gabbroic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Leucocratic, phaneritic crystalline rock composed of feldspathoids as 10-60 percent of the felsic minerals, alkali feldspar and mafic minerals. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 11. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:foid_syenitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: syénites foïdique
sienite foiditica
foid syenitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained crystalline rock containing more than 60 percent feldspathoids in total light-coloured constituents. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 15 or chemically in TAS field F. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:foiditic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche foïdique
roccia foiditica
foiditic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock containing more than 60 percent feldspathoids in total light-coloured constituents. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 15 (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:foidolite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: foïdolite
foidolite
foidolite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock in which 10 percent or more of the contained mineral grains are elements in a planar or linear fabric. Cataclastic or glassy character precludes classification with this concept. (based on NADM SLTT metamorphic)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:foliated_metamorphic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche métamorphique foliée
roccia metamorfica foliata
foliated metamorphic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material of unspecified consolidation state in which greater than 75 percent of the rock consists of fragments produced as a result of igneous rock-forming process. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:fragmental_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel igné fragmenté
materiale igneo frammentato
fragmental igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock in which greater than 75 percent of the rock consists of fragments produced as a result of igneous rock-forming process. Includes pyroclastic rocks, autobreccia associated with lava flows and intrusive breccias. Excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:fragmental_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée fragmentée
roccia ignea brecciata
fragmental igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate reef rock consisting of a rigid framework of colonies, shells or skeletons, with internal cavities filled with fine sediment; usually created through the activities of colonial organisms. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999; SLTTs, 2004, Table 15-3-1)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:framestone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: framestone
framestone
framestone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock composed essentially of calcic plagioclase (An50 to An100), pyroxene and iron oxides. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 10 as gabbro. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:gabbro
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: gabbros
gabbro
gabbro

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock composed of 65 percent or more of calcic plagioclase and up to 20 percent quartz or up to 10 percent feldspathoid. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 9 and 10 as gabbro or monzogabbro and foid-bearing varieties. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:gabbroic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche gabbroïque
roccia gabbrica
gabbroic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock that consists of greater than 90 percent glass. (NGMDB Glassy extrusive rock)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:glassy_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée vitreuse
roccia ignea vetrosa
glassy igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated metamorphic rock with bands or lenticles rich in granular minerals alternating with bands or lenticles rich in minerals with a flaky or elongate prismatic habit. Mylonitic foliation or well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of the rock consists of grains participate in a planar or linear fabric) precludes classification with this concept. (Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:gneiss
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: orthogneiss
gneiss
gneiss

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with recognizable depositional fabric that is grain-supported; contains little or no mud matrix. (Dunham 1962)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:grainstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: grainstone
grainstone
grainstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and plagioclase (typically sodic) in variable amounts, usually with biotite and/or hornblende. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 3. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:granite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granite
granito
granite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of quartz, alkali feldspar and/or plagioclase. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2, 3, 4 and 5 as alkali granite, granite, granodiorite or tonalite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:granitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granitoïdes
granitoide
granitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting essentially of quartz, sodic plagioclase and lesser amounts of alkali feldspar with minor hornblende and biotite. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 4. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:granodiorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: granodiorites
granodiorite
granodiorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic metamorphic rock with granoblastic fabric and very little or no foliation (less than 10 percent of the mineral grains in the rock are elements in a planar or linear fabric). (NADM SLTTm 2004)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:granofels
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: schiste tacheté (?)
granofels
granofels

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment containing greater than 30 percent gravel-size particles (greater than 2.0 mm diameter). (NADM SLTTs 2004)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:gravel
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: graviers
ghiaia
gravel

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic rock that consists of greater than 40 percent hornblende plus pyroxene and has a hornblende to pyroxene ratio greater than 1. Includes olivine hornblendite, olivine-pyroxene hornblendite, pyroxene hornblendite, and hornblendite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:hornblendite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: hornblendite
hornblendite
hornblendite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Granofels composed of a mosaic of equidimensional grains in a characteristically granoblastic or decussate matrix; porphyroblasts or relict phenocrysts may be present. Typically formed by contact metamorphism. (IUGS SCMR 2007 (http://www.bgs.ac.uk/SCMR/))
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:hornfels
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: cornéennes
hornfels (o granofels)
hornfels

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Earth material formed as a result of igneous processes, eg. intrusion and cooling of magma in the crust, volcanic eruption. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel igné
materiale igneo
igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed as a result of igneous processes, for example intrusion and cooling of magma in the crust, or volcanic eruption. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée
roccia ignea
igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock that contains features indicative of shock metamorphism, such as microscopic planar deformation features within grains or shatter cones. Includes breccias and melt rocks. (Stöffler and Grieve 2007; Jackson 1997)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:impact_metamorphic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: impactite
roccia metamorfica da impatto
impact metamorphic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous material with between 52 and 63 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:intermediate_composition_igneous_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel igné de composition intermédiaire
materiale igneo a composizione intermedia
intermediate composition igneous material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with between 52 and 63 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:intermediate_composition_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignés de composition intermédiaire
roccia ignea a composizione intermedia
intermediate composition igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment that consists of at least 50 percent iron-bearing minerals (hematite, magnetite, limonite-group, siderite, iron-sulfides), as determined by hand-lens or petrographic analysis. Corresponds to a rock typically containing 15 percent iron by weight. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:iron_rich_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment ferrugineux
sedimento ferrifero
iron rich sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material of unspecified consolidation state that consists of at least 50 percent iron-bearing minerals (hematite, magnetite, limonite-group, siderite, iron-sulfides), as determined by hand-lens or petrographic analysis. Corresponds to a rock typically containing 15 percent iron by weight. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:iron_rich_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire ferrugineux
materiale sedimentario ferrifero
iron rich sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock that consists of at least 50 percent iron-bearing minerals (hematite, magnetite, limonite-group, siderite, iron-sulfides), as determined by hand-lens or petrographic analysis. Corresponds to a rock typically containing 15 percent iron by weight. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999; NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:iron_rich_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire ferrugineux
roccia sedimentaria ferrifera
iron rich sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic volcanic rock, typically with spinifex texture of intergrown skeletal and bladed olivine and pyroxene crystals set in abundant glass. Includes picrite, komatiite and meimechite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:komatiitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche komatitique
komatiite
komatiitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock consisting of greater than 75 percent fine- to coarse-grained recrystallized calcite and/or dolomite; usually with a granoblastic, saccharoidal texture. (IUGS SCMR 2007 (http://www.bgs.ac.uk/SCMR/), SLTTm1.0 2004)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:marble
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: marbres
marmo
marble

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed by solid-state mineralogical, chemical and/or structural changes to a pre-existing rock, in response to marked changes in temperature, pressure, shearing stress and chemical environment; generally at depth in the crust. (Jackson 1997)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:metamorphic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: métamorphites indifférenciées
roccia metamorfica
metamorphic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Silicate metamorphic rock that is pervasively heterogeneous on a meso- to megascopic scale that typically consists of darker and lighter parts; the darker parts usually exhibit features of metamorphic rocks whereas the lighter parts are of igneous-looking appearance. (after IUGS SCMR 2007 (http://www.bgs.ac.uk/SCMR/))
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:migmatite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: migmatites
migmatite
migmatite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of sodic plagioclase (An0 to An50), alkali feldspar, hornblende and biotite, with or without pyroxene. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 9 as monzodiorite. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:monzodiorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: monzodiorite
monzodiorite
monzodiorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock consisting of calcic plagioclase (An50 to An100), alkali feldspar, hornblende and biotite, with or without pyroxene. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 9 as monzogabbro. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:monzogabbro
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: monzogabbro
monzogabbro
monzogabbro

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock containing almost equal amounts of plagioclase and alkali feldspar with minor amphibole and/or pyroxene and little or no quartz. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF Field 8. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:monzonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: monzonite
monzonite
monzonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sediment consisting of less than 30 percent gravel-size (2 mm) particles and with a mud to sand ratio greater than 1. Clasts may be of any composition or origin. (based on NADM SLTT sedimentary; Neuendorf et al. 2005; particle size from Wentworth grade scale)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:mud
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: boue
fango
mud

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sedimentary rock consisting of less than 30 percent gravel-size (2 mm) particles and with a mud to sand ratio greater than 1. Clasts may be of any composition or origin. (Pettijohn et al. 1987 referenced in Hallsworth and Knox 1999; extrapolated from Folk, 1954, Figure 1a)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:mudstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: mudstone
mudstone
mudstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock characterised by a foliation resulting from tectonic grain size reduction, in which more than 10 percent of the rock volume has undergone grain size reduction. Includes protomylonite, mylonite, ultramylonite, phyllonite and blastomylonite. (Marshak and Mitra 1988)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:mylonitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: mylonites
milonite
mylonitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated material known to have natural, ie. not human-made, origin. (NGMDB vocabulary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:natural_unconsolidated_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel naturel non consolidé
materiale naturale non consolidato
natural unconsolidated material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by chemical or biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by chemical or biological processes within the basin of deposition. (NGMDB 2008; Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:non_clastic_siliceous_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment siliceux non-clastique
sedimento siliceo non clastico
non-clastic siliceous sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by chemical or biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by chemical or biological processes within the basin of deposition. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:non_clastic_siliceous_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire siliceux non-clastique
materiale sedimentario siliceo non-clastico
non-clastic siliceous sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock that consists of at least 50 percent silicate mineral material, deposited directly by chemical or biological processes at the depositional surface, or in particles formed by chemical or biological processes within the basin of deposition. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:non_clastic_siliceous_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire siliceuse non-clastique
roccia sedimentaria silicea non clastica
non-clastic siliceous sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Mud with a sand to mud ratio less than 1 to 9 that contains at least 30 percent skeletal remains of pelagic organisms. Less than 1 percent gravel and less than 50 percent carbonate minerals. (based on Bates and Jackson 1987 and Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:ooze
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: vases
ooze
ooze

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment with color, composition, texture and apparent density indicating greater than 50 percent organic content by weight on a moisture-free basis. (NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:organic_rich_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment enrichie en matière organique
sedimento arricchito di materia organica
organic rich sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material in which 50 percent or more of the primary sedimentary material is organic carbon. (NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:organic_rich_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire enrichie en matière organique
materiale sedimentario arricchito di materia organica
organic rich sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock with color, composition, texture and apparent density indicating greater than 50 percent organic content by weight on a moisture-free basis. (NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:organic_rich_sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire enrichie en matière organique
roccia sedimentaria ricca di materia organica
organic rich sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary rock with discernible grain supported depositional texture, containing greater than 10 percent grains; intergranular spaces are filled by matrix. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:packstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: packstone
packstone
packstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated organic-rich sediment composed of at least 50 percent semi-carbonised plant remains; individual remains commonly seen with unaided eye; yellowish brown to brownish black; generally fibrous texture; can be plastic or friable. In its natural state it can be readily cut and has a very high moisture content, generally greater than 90 percent. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:peat
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tourbe
torba
peat

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Exceptionally coarse grained crystalline rock with interlocking crystals; most grains are 1cm or more diameter; composition is generally that of granite, but the term may refer to the coarse grained facies of any type of igneous rock;usually found as irregular dikes, lenses, or veins associated with plutons or batholiths. (Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:pegmatite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pegmatite
pegmatite
pegmatite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic rock consisting of more than 40 percent (by volume) olivine with pyroxene and/or amphibole and little or no feldspar. Commonly altered to serpentinite. Includes rocks defined modally in the ultramafic rock classification as dunite, harzburgite, lherzolite, wehrlite, olivinite, pyroxene peridotite, pyroxene hornblende peridotite or hornblende peridotite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:peridotite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: péridotites
peridotite
peridotite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock in which greater than 10 percent of rock is individual crystals that can be discerned with the unaided eye. Bounding grain size is on the order of 32 to 100 microns. Igneous rocks with 'exotic' composition are excluded from this concept. (Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phaneritic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée phanéritique
roccia ignea faneritica
phaneritic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained igneous rock containing feldspathoids and in which alkali feldspar is thought to be more abundant than plagioclase. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 11 and 12, and TAS field Ph. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phonolitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phonolites
fonolite
phonolitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are phosphate minerals. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phosphate_rich_sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire phosphaté
materiale sedimentario ricco di fosfati
phosphate rich sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sediment in which at least 50 percent of the primary and/or recrystallized constituents are phosphate minerals. (NGMDB 2008)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phosphatic_sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiment phosphaté
sedimento fosfatico
phosphatic sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary rock in which at least 50 percent of the primary or recrystallized constituents are phosphate minerals. Most commonly occurs as a bedded primary or reworked secondary marine rock, composed of microcrystalline carbonate fluorapatite in the form of lamina, pellets, oolites and nodules, and skeletal, shell and bone fragments. (HallsworthandKnox 1999, Jackson 1997)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phosphorite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phosphorite
fosforite
phosphorite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock with a well developed, continuous schistosity, an average grain size between 0.1 and 0.5 millimeters, and a silvery sheen on cleavage surfaces. Individual phyllosilicate grains are barely visible with the unaided eye. (IUGS SCMR 2007 (http://www.bgs.ac.uk/SCMR/))
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phyllite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phyllite
fillade
phyllite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Mylonitic rock composed largely of fine-grained mica that imparts a sheen to foliation surfaces; may have flaser lamination, isoclinal folding, and deformed veins, which indicate significant shearing. Macroscopically resembles phyllite, but formed by mechanical degradation of initially coarser rock. (NADM metamorphic rock vocabulary SLTTm1.0; Marshak and Mitra 1988)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:phyllonite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: phyllonite
fillonite
phyllonite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock that contains conspicuous phenocrysts in a finer grained groundmass; groundmass itself may be phaneritic or fine-grained. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:porphyry
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: porphyre
porfirite
porphyry

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fragmental igneous material that consists of more than 75 percent of particles formed by disruption as a direct result of volcanic action. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:pyroclastic_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel pyroclastique
materiale piroclastico
pyroclastic material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fragmental igneous rock that consists of greater than 75 percent fragments produced as a direct result of eruption or extrusion of magma from within the earth onto its surface. Includes autobreccia associated with lava flows and excludes deposits reworked by epiclastic processes. ()
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:pyroclastic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pyroclastites
piroclastite
pyroclastic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Ultramafic phaneritic igneous rock composed almost entirely of one or more pyroxenes and occasionally biotite, hornblende and olivine. Includes rocks defined modally in the ultramafic rock classification as olivine pyroxenite, olivine-hornblende pyroxenite, pyroxenite, orthopyroxenite, clinopyroxenite and websterite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:pyroxenite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: pyroxénite
pirossenite
pyroxenite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock that contains greater than 60 percent quartz. (Gillespie and Styles 1999; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:quartz_rich_phaneritic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée quartzique phanéritique
roccia ignea faneritica ricca in quarzo
quartz rich phaneritic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Metamorphic rock consisting of greater than or equal to 75 percent quartz; typically granoblastic texture. (after Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:quartzite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: quartzites
quarzite
quartzite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine-grained igneous rock, typically porphyritic, consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar (often as phenocrysts), with minor plagioclase and biotite, in a microcrystalline, cryptocrystalline or glassy groundmass. Flow texture is common. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 2 and 3 or chemically in TAS Field R as rhyolite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:rhyolitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: rhyolites
riolite
rhyolitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Consolidated aggregate of one or more EarthMaterials, or a body of undifferentiated mineral matter, or of solid organic material. Includes mineral aggregates such as granite, shale, marble; glassy matter such as obsidian; and organic material such a coal. Excludes unconsolidated materials. (Jackson, 1997; NADM C1 2004; Neuendorf et al 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche
roccia
rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sediment in which less than 30 percent of particles are gravel (greater than 2 mm in diameter) and the sand to mud ratio is at least 1. (Neuendorf et al. 2005; NGMDB)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:sand
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sables
sabbia
sand

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Clastic sedimentary rock in which less than 30 percent of particles are greater than 2 mm in diameter (gravel) and the sand to mud ratio is at least 1. (NGMDB; Neuendorf et al. 2005; particle size from Wentworth grade scale)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:sandstone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: grès
arenaria
sandstone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Foliated phaneritic metamorphic rock with well developed, continuous schistosity (greater than 50 percent of mineral grains with a tabular, lamellar, or prismatic crystallographic habit that are oriented in a continuous planar or linear fabric). (NADM metamorphic rock vocabulary SLTTm1.0; Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:schist
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: schistes
scisto
schist

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated material consisting of an aggregation of particles transported or deposited by air, water or ice, or that accumulated by other natural agents, such as chemical precipitation, and that forms in layers on the Earth's surface. Includes epiclastic deposits. (NADM SLTT sedimentary)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:sediment
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: sédiments
sedimento
sediment

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material formed by accumulation of solid fragmental material deposited by air, water or ice, or material that accumulated by other natural agents such as chemical precipitation from solution or secretion by organisms. Includes both sediment and sedimentary rock. Includes epiclastic deposits. (SLTTs [2004])
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:sedimentary_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel sédimentaire
materiale sedimentario
sedimentary material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock formed by accumulation and cementation of solid fragmental material deposited by air, water or ice, or as a result of other natural agents, such as precipitation from solution, the accumulation of organic material, or from biogenic processes, including secretion by organisms. Includes epiclastic deposits. (SLTTs [2004])
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:sedimentary_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche sédimentaire
roccia sedimentaria
sedimentary rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock consisting of more than 75 percent serpentine-group minerals, eg. antigorite, chrysotile or lizardite; accessory chlorite, talc and magnetite may be present; derived from hydration of ferromagnesian silicate minerals such as olivine and pyroxene. (Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:serpentinite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: serpentinites
serpentinite
serpentinite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Laminated mudstone that will part or break along thin, closely spaced layers parallel to stratification. (NADM SLTT sedimentary; Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:shale
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: shale
argillite o scisto
shale

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Compact, fine grained rock with an average grain size less than 0.032 millimeter and a well developed schistosity (slaty cleavage), and hence can be split into slabs or thin plates. (NADM metamorphic rock vocabulary SLTTm1.0; Neuendorf et al. 2005)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:slate
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: ardoise
ardesia
slate

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Coarse grained crystalline rock consisting mainly of alkali feldspar with subordinate sodic plagioclase, biotite, pyroxene, amphibole and occasional fayalite; minor quartz or nepheline may be present. Defined modally in QAPF Field 7. ()
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:syenite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: syénite
sienite
syenite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline igneous rock with M less than 90, consisting mainly of alkali feldspar and plagioclase; minor quartz or nepheline may be present, along with pyroxene, amphibole or biotite. Includes rocks classified in QAPF fields 6, 7 and 8 as syenite or monzonite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:syenitic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: syénite
roccia sienitica
syenitic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Unconsolidated pyroclastic material in which greater than 75 percent of the fragments are deposited as a direct result of volcanic processes and the deposit has not been reworked by epiclastic processes. Includes ash, lapilli tephra, bomb tephra, block tephra and unconsolidated agglomerate. (Hallsworth and Knox 1999; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:tephra
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: téphra
tefra
tephra

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine grained crystalline igneous rock containing essential feldspathoids and in which plagioclase is more abundant than alkali feldspar. Includes rocks classified in QAPF field 14 or chemically in TAS field U1 as basanite or tephrite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:tephritic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: téphrites
roccia tefritica
tephritic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phaneritic crystalline rock consisting of quartz and intermediate plagioclase, usually with biotite and amphibole. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF field 5. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:tonalite
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: tonalites
tonalite
tonalite

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fine-grained volcanic rock consisting of alkali feldspar and minor mafic minerals, typically amphibole or mica; typically porphyritic. Includes rocks defined modally in QAPF fields 6, 7 and 8 or chemically in TAS Field T as trachyte or latite. (LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:trachytic_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: trachytes
trachite
trachytic rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Pyroclastic rock in which greater than 25 percent of particles are greater than 64 mm in largest dimension. Includes agglomerate, pyroclastic breccia of Gillespie and Styles (1999) (Schmid 1981; LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:tuff_breccia_agglomerate_or_pyroclastic_breccia
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: brèche tuffacée, agglomérat, ou brêche pyroclastique
tufo a blocchi agglomerato, breccia piroclastica
tuff-breccia, agglomerate, or pyroclastic breccia

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Igneous rock with less than 45 percent SiO2. (after LeMaitre et al. 2002)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:ultrabasic_igneous_rock
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: roche ignée ultrabasique
roccia ignea ultrabasica
ultrabasic igneous rock

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: CompoundMaterial composed of an aggregation of particles that do not adhere to each other strongly enough that the aggregate can be considered a solid in its own right. (NGMDB)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:unconsolidated_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: matériel non consolidé
materiale non consolidato
unconsolidated material

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone that contains between 15 and 75 percent matrix of unspecified origin. (CGI concepts task group)
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:wackestone
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: wackestone
wackestone
wackestone

gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:description: An Earth Material composed of an aggregation of particles of Earth Material, possibly including other Compound Materials. This is 'top' of lithology category hierarchy, and should be used to indicate 'any rock or unconsolidated material'.
gsml:ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:SimpleLithology:2008:compound_material
gsml:ControlledConcept.gsml:name: compound material
